intro: Seseli haussknechtii, commonly known as the Hausseckner's seseli, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high elevations, where it thrives in cool, moist environments. Its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements make it a subject of interest for botanists studying alpine flora. Due to its rarity and ecological significance, it is often protected in its native range.
